content.rendered:
Explore the possibilities
Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
Start here
You are not alone
Discover our community of online support for parents and families.
Find support
Build your knowledge
Explore our website and watch our webinars designed for parents
View our webinars
Previous slide
Next slide

  • Your child’s hearing
  • Language and communication

  • Education

  • Sport
  • Music

Learn

  • Making informed decisions – a course for parents
  • Giving your children a strong Auslan foundation
  • We are all ears: Learning from parents’ experiences about hearing aid use in their young children
  • Deaf Culture 101
  • Sports participation and opportunities for kids who are deaf or hard of hearing
  • Fire safety for families with children who are deaf or hard of hearing
  • Making informed decisions – a course for parents
  • Giving your children a strong Auslan foundation
  • We are all ears: Learning from parents’ experiences about hearing aid use in their young children
  • Deaf Culture 101
  • Sports participation and opportunities for kids who are deaf or hard of hearing
  • Fire safety for families with children who are deaf or hard of hearing

Information and support for families raising children with hearing loss

Join our community of families with children with hearing loss to discover the benefits of family-to-family support and tap into the collective wisdom of others on similar journeys.
Find support

How your donation helps deaf children

Thanks to people like you, we can continue to make a difference. Your donation to Aussie Deaf Kids helps us to share knowledge with families, offer essential family-to-family support, and represent their perspectives in research and program development. Your contribution is essential in assisting deaf children and their families to thrive.

We couldn’t do what we do without the support of people like you.

Donate

News and Information

Click here to check out our new website page that will hopefully guide parents who want to know how and where to learn Auslan, for

For parents of children who are deaf or hard of hearing, creating a supportive home is key. There are many assistive listening devices designed to

Read More »
Deaf-friendly family activities
15/08/2024

Here are some engaging and inclusive games and activities for families with children who are deaf or hard of hearing. These activities promote communication, social

Read More »
